Entries.Name: WOTC Female Hair Pack
Entries.Author: Kexx
Entries.Description:
[h1]Release #33[/h1]
Mod ID: 1471399748
[h1]WOTC ONLY[/h1]

-------------------------------------------
UPDATE 1: The GREEN Update
-------------------------------------------
Added 27 new Hairstyles:
3 Short
6 Medium
6 Long
8 Ponytail
2 Braid
1 Astery
1 Variant
-------------------------------------------

In an effort to broaden the Hair variety, I come to the community with offerings! [b]73 of them!![/b] 
And I'm not alone! [b]Astery[/b] has not only helped me, but joined me in this crusade! What a mad man!

[h1]In this Pack you will find the following:[/h1]

3 Vanilla Mash-ups
4 Bandana Hair Styles
14 Short Hair Styles
12 Medium Hair Styles
11 Long Hair Styles
11 Ponytail Hair Styles
6 Braid Hair Styles
12 Astery's Hair Styles

All are tintable, all have Physics. None have fallbacks. Why wear hats and helmets, when you have fabulous new hair??!!

Please keep in mind, these are for female soldiers only. 
A separate Pack for male soldiers will be worked on.

No copyright infringement intended, this is purely a work of passion and fandom! All assets are owned by their original creators.

If you enjoyed this mod, please don't forget to rate and favorite it, it really helps! Take pictures! We wanna see your squads!

[h1]Want More?[/h1]
Don't forget to check out my Workshop Page for more!
http://steamcommunity.com/id/kexx4556/myworkshopfiles/?appid=268500

As well as Astery's Workshop Page for even more goodies!
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Astery/myworkshopfiles/?appid=268500

[h1][b]CREDITS & SPECIAL THANKS[/b][/h1]
[b]Astery[/b] - Teaching me how Physics work, and 12 BOOMBASTIC additional new Hair Styles!
[b]Spart117MC[/b] - Providing a working template for Hair Rig.
[b]Deviantart community[/b] - Providing the assets for us to work on. Thank you all so much!
[b]Mr. Kablamm0Fish[/b] - My mentor and sensei, for teaching me how meshes and rigs work.
[b]E3245[/b] - Teaching me how textures and materials work.
[b]Team CX[/b] - Unending support, feedback, and jolly good times.
[b]Destroyer1101[/b] - Spiritual Guide and Inspiration. Thanks for your hard work!

[h1][u]I hate you and everything you stand for, but I still wanna throw some money your way. How?[/u][/h1]
- Things have changed. I won't bore you with specifics, but suffice to say, 2020 didn't skip me with it's "let's-utterly-destroy-this-person's-life" stick. First and foremost, it's important that I state I will NEVER gate content behind a pay wall. Every thing I do for the community, is and will continue to be free and for everyone. That said, if you have enjoyed my mods as much as I've enjoyed making them, and would like to thank, tip, or support my modding endeavor, you can do so here!! : https://www.buymeacoffee.com/kexx

Entries.Name: WOTC Female Clothing Pack
Entries.Author: Kexx
Entries.Description:
[h1]Release #34[/h1]
Mod ID: 1586643354
[h1]WOTC ONLY[/h1]
-------------------------------------------
UPDATE 2: The YELLOW Update
-------------------------------------------
With this update, we finalize with 281 items! Any more Female Clothing Pack Updates will happen in a new, separate, stand alone mod, instead of this one, to avoid bulking up the size of the mod any further.

[h1]In this Update you will find the following:[/h1]
14 Torsos
9 Legs
47 Props

[h1][b]WARNING:[/b][/h1]
Proper Localization meant changing the template name of each item. I strongly advice starting a new campaign. Any existing soldiers who were using items from this mod prior to the update, will now have invisible parts, and NO way to change them. I've added a new Discussion Tab to see how you can address this.

Enjoy!
-----------------------------------------
UPDATE 1: The GREEN Update
-----------------------------------------
It's finally here! New additions have us over 200 items!

[h1]In this Update you will find the following:[/h1]
21 Torsos
13 Legs
40 Props

Enjoy!
-----------------------------------------

There's plenty of Soldier Armor and Tacti-cool Cosmetic Mods out there, but not nearly enough
civilian looks. This mod aims to remedy that by adding a whopping 137 different customizable
items, ranging from ragtag looks to more casual fare, and everything in between!

[h1]In this Pack you will find the following:[/h1]
30 Torsos
19 Legs
88 Props (includes L/R Arms, Scars, Facepaints, and every conceivable customization slot)

For maximum customizability, I have added same items in different categories. This means for
example, you will find the "Aviators on Forehead" under Helmets, Upper Face Props and Lower
Face Props. You will find the "Drum Jacket" under Torso Deco, L and R Arm Decos.

If you find this method clutters your lists or spawns horrible looking rookies, instructions
on how to add and remove items can be found in the ReadMe, as well as inside each of the
3 individual XComContent.ini files; Torso Pack, Leg Pack and Props Pack folders.

You can find them here: ...Steam Games/steamapps/workshop/content/268500/1586643354/Config

Keep in mind, every item has been re-fitted and re-rigged to xcom proportions, and with only
a handful of particulars, the vast majority of items work in beautiful harmony. All Jackets
and Decos fit over most Torsos. That said, I am not a professional, so please excuse some very,
very minor clipping on a few of these.

[h1]Please keep in mind, these are for Female soldiers only.[/h1]
[h1]There are currently no plans for a Male Pack.[/h1]

[h1][b]SOFT REQUIREMENT :[/b][/h1]
- [u]Anarchy's Children DLC.[/u] Few items in this pack use materials and textures from this DLC, such as the Hot Shorts, Knuckle Duster gloves, Ammo Gauntlets and a few others. Note, it is a SOFT requirement. If you do not own this DLC, you can still use this mod. At worse, those few items won't display those textures correctly.

No copyright infringement intended, this is purely a work of passion and fandom! All assets are owned by their original creators.

If you enjoyed this mod, please don't forget to rate and favorite it, it really helps! Take pictures! I wanna see your squads!

[h1]Want More?[/h1]
Don't forget to check out my Workshop Page for more!
http://steamcommunity.com/id/kexx4556/myworkshopfiles/?appid=268500

[h1][b]CREDITS & SPECIAL THANKS[/b][/h1]
[b]Deviantart community[/b] - Providing the assets for me to work on. Thank you all so much!
[b]Team CX[/b] - Unending support, guidance, feedback, and jolly good times.

[h1][u]I hate you and everything you stand for, but I still wanna throw some money your way. How?[/u][/h1]
- Things have changed. I won't bore you with specifics, but suffice to say, 2020 didn't skip me with it's "let's-utterly-destroy-this-person's-life" stick. First and foremost, it's important that I state I will NEVER gate content behind a pay wall. Every thing I do for the community, is and will continue to be free and for everyone. That said, if you have enjoyed my mods as much as I've enjoyed making them, and would like to thank, tip, or support my modding endeavor, you can do so here!! : https://www.buymeacoffee.com/kexx

Entries.Name: WOTC Male Hair Pack
Entries.Author: Kexx
Entries.Description:
[h1]Release #35[/h1]
Mod ID: 1733669574
[h1]WOTC ONLY[/h1]

Get your hair dryers and mustache combs ready, commanders. My effort to expand the Hair variety
continues. Tip your hats, folks; as Astery has returned to my crusade, this time with 18 offerings,
 making a grand total of 64 fully customizable hairstyles and beards!! 

[h1][u]In this Pack you will find the following:[/u][/h1]
1 Vanilla Mash-up                    
2 Bandana Hair Styles
16 Short Hair Styles                 
9 Medium Hair Styles
4 Long Hair Styles                   
3 Ponytail Hair Styles
3 Braid Hair Styles                 
17 Astery's Hair Styles
8 Beard Styles                         
1 Astery's Beard Style

All are tintable, all have Physics. None have fallbacks. Why wear hats and helmets, when you have fabulous new hair??!!

No copyright infringement intended, this is purely a work of passion and fandom! All assets are owned by their original creators.

If you enjoyed this mod, please don't forget to rate and favorite it, it really helps! Take pictures! We wanna see your squads!

[h1]Want More?[/h1]
Don't forget to check out my Workshop Page!
http://steamcommunity.com/id/kexx4556/myworkshopfiles/?appid=268500

As well as Astery's Workshop Page for even more goodies!
https://steamcommunity.com/id/Astery/myworkshopfiles/?appid=268500

[h1][b]CREDITS & SPECIAL THANKS[/b][/h1]
[b]Astery[/b] - Teaching me how Physics work, and 18 FABULOUS additional new Hair Styles and Beards!
[b]E3245[/b] - Additional polishing and fine tuning.
[b]Spart117MC[/b] - Providing a working template for Hair Rig.
[b]Team CX[/b] - Unending support, feedback, and jolly good times.
[b]Deviantart community[/b] - Providing the assets for us to work on. Thank you all so much!

[h1][b]FAQ[/b][/h1]
[b][u]1. WOTC Only?? That's just a stupid zombie cash grab. Vanilla when?[/u][/b]
- WOTC only. There will be no vanilla version coming.

[b][u]2. But... why though?[/u][/b]
- As explained before, while WOTC is indeed an expansion to XCOM 2, in terms of "under the hood", they could very well be two different games. This presents huge complications to us modders. Each version of the game has it's own separate 90+ GB SDK. Many, myself included, don't have the space.

Furthermore, many things changed from one to the other; new coding scripts, new texture and material shaders, etc. So even if we did have the space for both, we can't just compile the assets in each, and be done with it. Much needs to change with how each piece is added to the game. The assets need to be reworked, the textures need to be heavily altered, sometimes even start from scratch, code needs to be rewritten, etc. I hope this clarifies why many modders have left vanilla behind. 

[b][u]3. Dudes? Who uses dudes? Where's the female salon?[/u][/b]
- We got you covered right here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1471399748

[b][u]4. Some of the beards clip through some of the faces, what gives?[/u][/b]
- Making beards requires rigging them to each face bone(there's 50+ bones). It's essentially like making faces, which is a huge time investment and very difficult to do. On top of that, each one would require a specific, individual Morph Target, to account for each face of each race. This is simply beyond our skill level and scope of understanding.

[b][u]5. I like many of these, but I dislike many as well. Could you give us a How-To to remove those?[/u][/b]
- Sure thing, my friend. First you'll want to navigate to the mod's Config Folder. You can find it here: 

...Steam Games/steamapps/workshop/content/268500/1733669574/Config

Inside you will find a file named XComContent.ini. Open it, and simply place a semicolon (;) in front
of the line of the item you want the game to ignore. The line you're looking for looks like this:

+BodyPartTemplateConfig=(PartType="Hair", ......

After you're done with your magic, it'll look like this:

;+BodyPartTemplateConfig=(PartType="Hair", ......

[b][u]6. What's your To-Do list look like?[/u][/b]
- In no particular order:
Update Female Hair Pack
Update Female Clothing Pack
Face Pack
ME Squadmates

[h1][u]I hate you and everything you stand for, but I still wanna throw some money your way. How?[/u][/h1]
- Things have changed. I won't bore you with specifics, but suffice to say, 2020 didn't skip me with it's "let's-utterly-destroy-this-person's-life" stick. First and foremost, it's important that I state I will NEVER gate content behind a pay wall. Every thing I do for the community, is and will continue to be free and for everyone. That said, if you have enjoyed my mods as much as I've enjoyed making them, and would like to thank, tip, or support my modding endeavor, you can do so here!! : https://www.buymeacoffee.com/kexx

Entries.Name: [WOTC] No Tech Gated Helmets
Entries.Author: Aut
Entries.Description:
Removes the armor and faction soldier requirements for helmets, allowing you to use the plated, powered, faction soldier, and alien ruler helmets from the very start, and on every soldier type (except SPARKs).

This mod applys to helmets added by mods, such as the powered helmets from 
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1123427895.]Capnbubs Accessories[/url]. I also recommend using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1135440846]Unrestricted Customization[/url] with this mod so you can use the look of the armors these helmets are designed for from the start.

Thanks to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Iridar/.]Iridar[/url] for doing most of the scripting for the mod.

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Item Hider by Iridar
Entries.Author: Iridar
Entries.Description:
Allows hiding unwanted items and schematics from HQ inventory and Engineering through [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=667104300][b]Mod Config Menu[/b][/url] or configuration.

Hidden items become "ghost templates" and can still be used by [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2337161588][b]XSkin[/b][/url], [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1517938486]Weapon Skin Replacer[/url][/b] or [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2363075446]Template Master[/url][/b].

[h1]SAFETY WARNING[/h1]

Removed items can be restored [b]ONLY[/b] by loading a previous save.

It's possible to permanently break your campaign if this mod is used carelessly. Use at your own risk. 

[h1]REQUIREMENTS[/h1]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1134256495][b]X2 WOTC Community Highlander[/b][/url] is required.
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=667104300][b]Mod Config Menu[/b][/url] is recommended, but not mandatory.

[h1]COMPATIBILITY[/h1]

Should be compatible with everything. Can be safely added or removed mid campaign. Keep in mind removed items will NOT be restored if this mod is removed.

[h1]CONFIGURATION[/h1]

The default configuration for this mod is stored in this file. You can add unwanted item templates to the [b][i]ItemsToHide[/i][/b] list in this configuration file, but be aware that any changes you do to it may be lost if this mod is updated.
[code]..\steamapps\workshop\content\268500\2589916279\Config\XComWOTCIridarWeaponHider_DEFAULT.ini[/code]

Your MCM configuration for this mod is stored in this file. You may want to back it up in when deleting the user config folder.
[code]..\Documents\my games\XCOM2 War of the Chosen\XComGame\Config\XComWOTCIridarWeaponHider.ini[/code]

[h1]KNOWN ISSUES[/h1]

Depending on how you set up the item filters in MCM, the item list may take a while to load.

In my testing the mod crashed the game when attempting to display more than 263 items per page. I set up the mod to split the item list across several pages, with 250 items per page. If you experience crashes when entering MCM screen for this mod, try reducing the [b][i]SettingsPerPage[/i][/b] value in the default configuration file.

[h1]CREDITS[/h1]

Please consider [b][url=https://www.patreon.com/Iridar]supporting me on patreon[/url][/b] so I can afford the time to make more awesome mods.

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Iridar's Appearance Manager
Entries.Author: Iridar
Entries.Description:
Adds new functionality to Character Pool and new interface to manage units' appearance, as well as an automated Uniform Manager.

For a brief overview of the mod's functions, check the introduction video above, or click the link below for an in-depth explanation.

[b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2664422411/3194737075878800834/]>>> DETAILED INSTRUCTIONS <<<[/url][/b]

[h1]New Soldier Customization UI[/h1]
[list]
[*] New "Manage Appearance" screen. Allows copying units' entire or partial appearance onto other units, as well as importing soldier appearance from Character Pool or Memorial, or putting uniforms on soldiers. You can also make sweeping changes to your entire Squad, Barracks or Character Pool. This can be used, for example, to quickly set the same camouflage for the entire Squad.
[*] New "Stored Appearance" screen. Allows viewing, "equipping" and deleting stored appearance for each armor the soldier have ever equipped.[/list]

[h1]Character Pool Changes[/h1]
[list]
[*] Character Pool soldier list is now sorted and shows soldiers' class.
[*] A "Search" button has been added to quickly filter out soldiers based on their name or class.
[*] You can now Shift+Click to select or deselect multiple soldiers in Character Pool.
[*] Character Pool now saves Appearance Store - individual unit appearance for each armor.
[*] It's now possible to pre-customize appearance of Character Pool units for each armor by equipping said armor on the new Loadout screen. Weapons can also be previewed in Character Pool.
[*] "Dormant" character pool units that do not appear in the campaign are now allowed.
[*] Appearance validation is now turned off in debug game mode, and can be also turned off in normal game mode. Appearance validation is the game attempting to correct the appearance of Character Pool units if their cosmetic body parts become missing, typically because cosmetic mods with those body parts have been deactivated. Disabling validation allows temporarily disabling cosmetic mods without losing the customized appearance of your Character Pool. If appearance validation is currently disabled, a new button is added to soldier customization screen to perform it manually for specific soldiers.
[*] Individual Character Pool units can be converted to Uniforms. Uniforms are grouped separately on the Manage Appearance screen, and may be applied to soldiers manually or automatically.[/list]

[h1]Automated Uniform Manager[/h1]
[list]
[*] When soldiers equip new armor for the first time, the mod will look for a suitable Uniform in Character Pool, and apply it automatically. 
[*] Individual soldiers and Uniforms can be excluded from participating in this automated process.
[*] This system can be disabled globally in Mod Config Menu. If disabled globally, individual units can still be included in the automated process.
[*] You can also work with Uniforms manually using the Manage Appearance screen.
[*] Uniforms can be shared through Character Pool files.[/list]

[h1]Automated Backups[/h1]

If you start the game with Appearance Manager disabled, there's a high chance all of the extra information about Character Pool units, like their Appearance Store and uniform status, will be lost. To prevent you from potentially losing hours of customizing your character pool, Appearance Manager makes automatic backups of the character pool. 

The next time you start the game with Appearance Manager enabled, you will get a pop-up message asking whether you want to restore the Character Pool from backup.

[h1]Be careful with[/h1]
[list]
[*] Any stored appearance on the Uniform unit will count as a potential uniform, so when you are done setting up a uniform, make sure to go to Stored Appearance screen and delete any unwanted appearances.
[*] Be very careful when you [b]Apply Changes[/b] to multiple units. Double check cosmetic options you have enabled, otherwise you might accidentally give the same face to all soldiers in your barracks, for example.[/list]

[h1]REQUIREMENTS[/h1]
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1134256495][b]X2 WOTC Community Highlander[/b][/url] is required.
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=667104300][b][WotC] Mod Config Menu[/b][/url] is supported, but not a hard requirement.
[*]Safe to add or remove mid-campaign.[/list]

[h1]COMPATIBILITY WITH UNRESTRICTED CUSTOMIZATION[/h1]

Appearance Manager has limited compatibility with [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1135440846]Unrestricted Customization - Wotc[/url][/b] and its [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2438621356]Redux version[/url][/b]. They make Appearance Store a mess, so Stored Appearance screen becomes useless. Manage Apperance screen is switched into compatibility mode where you can import only other units' current appearance.

You should still be able to set up and apply uniforms automatically or manually, but you will have to use one Uniform unit per appearance, storing appearances for different armors  within one uniform unit will become impossible.

[h1]COMPATIBILITY[/h1]

Appearance Manager replaces [i][b]CharacterPoolManager[/b][/i] and will be incompatible with any mod that does the same. It also has the following ModClassOverrides:
[code]
UICharacterPool - can be safely disabled by removing its entry in this mod's XComEngine.ini. Doing so will disable sorting and the "Search" button.

UICharacterPool_ListPools - required for the mod to Import and Export additional information to and from Character Pool files created with this mod.[/code][list]
[*] [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1136878667]WOTC Extended Character Pool[/url][/b], Sorted Character Pool, [WOTC] Sort Characters by Callsign - compatible if you disable Appearance Manager's ModClassOverride for [b][i]UICharacterPool[/i][/b].
[/list]

Other than that, should be compatible with anything and everything.

[h1]CONFIGURATION[/h1]

Presets and MCM settings for this mod are stored in this file. You might want to back it up when deleting User Config folder.
[code]..\Documents\my games\XCOM2 War of the Chosen\XComGame\ConfigXComAppearanceManager.ini[/code]

Mod's default configuration is located here:
[code]..\steamapps\workshop\content\268500\2664422411\Config\[/code]

[h1]COMPANION MODS[/h1]
[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2518586673][b][WOTC] No Tech Gated Helmets[/b][/url] - allows equipping any helmet in Character Pool.
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125727531][b]WOTC Use My Class[/b][/url] - makes soldiers properly promote to the soldier class set in Character Pool.
[*] [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2589916279][WOTC] Item Hider[/url][/b] - hidden items do not appear as equippable in Character Pool Loadout screen.[/list]

[h1]KNOWN ISSUES[/h1]

In case of non-soldier uniforms for some characters, like Shen, their body will clip through the cosmetic body parts added by their uniform.

Mod causes a ton of log warnings and redscreens while working with Character Pool Loadout. Those are annoying, but completely harmless, and fixing them all would require more effort and Highlander changes than it's worth.

[h1]CREDITS[/h1]

Huge thanks to [b]Xymanek (Astral Descend)[/b] for crucial code support and UI improvements.
Thanks to my beta testers: [b]RustyDios, lago508, Deadput[/b].
Blame [b]Veehementia[/b] for making me think that making this mod was a good idea.

Please [b][url=https://www.patreon.com/Iridar]support me on Patreon[/url][/b] if you require tech support, have a suggestion for a feature, or simply wish to help me create more awesome mods.

Entries.Name: WOTC Use My Class
Entries.Author: krj12
Entries.Description:
NOTE:

This is a straight recompile of the original "Use My Class" mod.  I received no compile errors, so at this time no changes have been made.

Original mod can be found here:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=684929720

Several users reported issues with the original mod in WOTC, which I cannot duplicate.  I may or may not keep this version published depending on user reports.


DESCRIPTION:

This mod forces the game to use your specified class in the character pool, when it 
promotes rookies from the After Action screen. It also changes logic to 
honor the character pool class when giving a soldier as a mission reward.

Details:

The mod matches any character by first and last name in your character pool, 
and uses your selected class.

If you have the soldier defined as a Rookie, the game will assign a class randomly, 
just as it currently does.

If you have the soldier defined as a Psi Operative, it will assign a PsiOperative,
however, that soldier will not be trainable until the requisite facility is built.

If you are having problems getting it to work...
Please read the pinned discussion section below first for suggestions on how to resolve the issue.


If you find this mod useful, a thumbs up would be very much appreciated.



HISTORY:

Update 6/14/2016:
Replaced class override for X2StrategyElement_DefaultRewards, to hopefully help reduce conflicts.


Update 6/25/2016:
Opened up logic to allow soldiers to be promoted to Psi Operatives.

Considerations:
1. The soldier will have no powers at his disposal until the Psi Ops facility is build 
and he begins training.
2. Soldiers given as mission rewards will also have no powers until they begin training, 
regardless of starting rank.
3. These soldiers will need to be started out in the Psi Ops facility just like rookies to begin 
their powers training. Until this starts, they only have the rifle and are of limited use on
missions. They will be listed in the drop down along with any rookies you have available.

Entries.Name: Disable Any Class Wotc
Entries.Author: Divine Lucubration
Entries.Description:
Vanilla (non-WotC) version: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=656267587

Disable Any Class

What this mod does:
- Prevents disabled classes from being selected by unit promitions, mission rewards, the resistance headquarters or the black market.

What this mod does NOT do:
- Remove knowledge of disabled classes from the game engine.
- Prevent the user from training disabled classes at the GTS.
- Remove perks for disabled classes from the GTS.

Disabled classes can be selected at any time from an in-game mod configuration menu using this mod and will apply to any campaigns played while the mod is active.

Disable Any Class currently uses [WotC] Mod Config Menu to provide the in-game UI for selecting disabled classes.

Known Bugs:
It's entirely possible that I've missed some condition under which soldier classes are automatically chosen. If you receive a disabled character class during your campaign, please let me know how that happened!

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Less Overwatch Lock Ups!
Entries.Author: Mr. Nice
Entries.Description:
"Less Overwatch Lock Ups!" is a bugfix mod, to hopefully cut down on "soft locks" during complex overwatch/reaction fire situations, and also when  a solider is revealed by enemy movement.
A "soft lock" is when the game doesn't crash as such, but is stuck showing a single moment in "time". If you've experienced this, then you know that sometimes the game "frees" itself after some time, but other times freezes until you give up and quit. If it's the problem with the Reaction Fire Sequencer or the wait on "nothing", then the lock won't happen at all. For the other fixes, the intial freeze will almost certianly still happen, but the game should be more likely to free itself.

[h1][b]Actual changes made by this mod (warning this list is a bit technical!)[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]'X2ReactionFireSequencer' No longer marks all shots by the same shooter against the same target in the same sequence as "started" when the first shot starts, this stops the later shots from starting at all!
[*]'X2Action_WaitForAnotherAction' will Tme Out after 60 seconds and stop waiting regardless.
[*]'X2Action_WaitForDestructibleActorActionTrigger' will not wait at all if it is set to wait on "nothing", which would otherwise lock it indefinitely. A similar fix was made to 'X2Action_WaitForAnotherAction' in the October Patch.
[*]'X2Action_WaitForDestructibleActorActionTrigger' is also given a 60 second Time Out.
[*]'X2Action_MoveDirect' will not wait for the "Stopping" animation triggered when it Times Out to finish.
[/list]

[h1][b]Other Advice![/b][/h1]
it is possible to free visualization "soft locks" with a console command, and I don't promise that this mod will deal with all possible visualization problems!. To enable the console, add -allowConsole to the command line/launch options. The actual key to drop the console varies with regional keyboard variants, but with a US keyboard is is the tilde key (~) above the tab key, with a UK keyboard, it is the apostrophe/@ key.

[b]Instructions[/b]
[list]
[*]Type X2DebugVisualizer at the console.
[*]A pretty(?) UI overlay should appear, for you, the important thing is the "Clear Hangs" button in the top Left. Click it!
[*]Type  X2DebugVisualizer at the console again to clear the visualizer debugging UI overlay.
[/list]

[h1][b]Compatability[/b][/h1]
Overrides:
[list]
[*]X2ReactionFireSequencer
[*]X2Action_WaitForAnotherAction
[*]X2Action_WaitForDestructibleActorActionTrigger
[*]'X2Action_MoveDirect
[/list]
These are quite technical classes, and it is unlikely that they will be overriden for non bug fixing reasons. Nonethess, this mod will not be compatbile with mods which override any of these three classes.

[h1][b]Other Mods by me[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*][b]WOTC Compatible[/b] (non-WOTC versions also exist if appropriate)
[list]
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1124794449]Cinematic Rapid Fire[/url], which gives Rapid Fire and Chain Shot their cinematic camera back which was removed in the patch ages ago. Also gives the Reaper Banish ability the same improved look.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1577947114]Variant Power Armour Arms[/url], which unlocks some variant Wraith and Warden armour arms parts which were hidden by Firaxis.
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1489472552]Better Armory Item Stats[/url], which tweaks the stats display of weapons, utility items and upgrades in the Armoury, including displaying Critical Damage, Armor Pierce and Shred for all appropriate weapons.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1737532501]Weapon Fixes[/url], Which fixes a few issues with weapons and their upgrades, especially if you use mods which allow upgrades for (auto)pistols.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1742101690]Chosen Info Controller Support[/url], adds controller support for bringing up the Chosen Information Screen mid mission.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1537820510]Peter's Grenades (and other TLP Fixes)[/url], which fixes some loadout, ability progression and UI issues with Legacy Operations.
[*][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1525019760]Better Demolishing![/url], which gives range, weapon and upgrade based aim buffs to the 'Demolition' ability.
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1486607466]Better Grappling![/url], fixes issues with Grappling targeting in certain world geometry.
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1124507705]Shaken Scars are Back![/url] The name says it all, but to those who weren't around for the first couple of months of XCom2, a feature was bugged out in a patch and never fixed, which randomly scarred shaken soldiers. This now means some, but not all, gravely wounded soldiers, not the "new" WotC shaken fatigue status.
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1133858760]Trainable Sparks (and other Buffs)[/url] WotC was one step forward, two steps back for SPARKs. As well as allowing training, also gives them access to breakthroughs for their weapons, an ammo pocket (ammunition only utility slot), and some hack progression.
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1133854368]Train from Armoury[/url] allows normal soldiers to jump straight to training from the armoury, just as faction soldiers can. The Training Center is still required to be built first of course!
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1130400927]Original High Hit Dodge Behaviour[/url], which restores the pre-patch behaviour where Hit chance over 100 gradually eliminated dodge chance, not immediately made dodges impossible once Hit chance is 100 or more.
[*]In conjuction wtih sebkulu,[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1183444470]WOTC - Extended Information![/url], an enhanced, rewritten version of Perfect Information. Includes full list of enemy abilities as well as a stat list, as well as the classic features of the "shot bar" and stats in flyovers.
[/list]
[*][b]Non-WOTC Only[/b]
[list]
[*][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=859638931]Armoury Navigation Fixes[/url], the navigation bar issues this mod fixed are now not bugged in WOTC.
[/list]
[/list]

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Choose My Class
Entries.Author: shiremct
Entries.Description:
[h1][WOTC] Choose My Class[/h1]

A lighter alternative to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=688405905] [b]Commander's Choice[/b] [/url], Choose My Class lets you choose from a random selection of 3 (# is configurable) classes when a rookie gets promoted, without laying out every single option available. It's a middle-ground between NO choice (base game) and ANY choice (Commanders Choice). It's similar to the promotion mechanics in EU/EW.

Makes a good companion mod to [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125727531] [b][WOTC] Use My Class[/b] [/url] - by default, the first class option will be reserved for the class specified in the unit's character pool template, if applicable and available (this behavior can also be toggled to always fully random choices, if desired).

Designed to work with [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148535137] [b][WOTC] Disable Any Class[/b] [/url], an easy way to manage enabling/disabling individual classes without worrying about config changes being overwritten during updates (Note: sometimes this is finicky and may take resetting the choices in the Disable Any Class MCM menu a time or two to properly take effect.)



The options available to a soldier may change a bit when either adding/removing new classes from rotation, changing relative weights of classes (class NumInDeck values), or toggling the UseMyClass option reserving the first choice to the character pool defined class. This is all by design - in general, you are stuck with the handful of options from the pool given to each soldier (or *gasp* use the GTS!?!), but changes to the pool of available classes WILL get filtered in. Adding, removing, and updating mods shouldn't break your unpromoted rookies.

[h1]Known [Minor] Issues[/h1]
[list]
[*] This is intended as an alternative, but you CAN run it alongside Commander's Choice if you want - though there will be some small cosmetic spacing issues with the menus if you run them both at the same time.
[*] This is heavily based on Commander's Choice and has many of the same minor issues (using the arrow keys on a class' ability tree to navigate to a promotable rookie will promote them randomly like the base game, etc.).
[*] Uses a pseudo-random roll to prevent the class options from re-rolling every time you click the button - works well, but the complexity of that roll may need to be increased in the future if strong patterns become apparant over time (like the first units of campaigns always rolling similar options, etc.) - let me know if things start to get too predictable.
[*] The default value of 3 choices is probably too many if you are only playing with the 4 base game classes (zzzz) - I would advise adjusting it down to 2 in that situation.
[*] Bad preview image is bad. Sorry.
[/list]


[h1]Thanks and Credits[/h1]

This is largely based on Commander's Choice, so credit to those guys for amazing work on a long-time staple. Also big thanks to robojumper for helping point me in the right direction for storing the available choices with the pseudo-random rolls.


[h1]Version History[/h1] (See Change Notes for full history)
[list]
1.0.7:[list]
[*] Updated some GameState handling to hopefully fix issues with other mods making changes in armory.[/list]
[/list]

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Community Promotion Screen
Entries.Author: x2communitycore
Entries.Description:
[b]Community Promotion Screen[/b] is an expanded and improved version of the [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1124609091][WOTC] New Promotion Screen by Default[/url][/b]. It replaces the standard soldier promotion screen with a modified version of the "Faction Hero" promotion screen that was added in War of the Chosen.

If you use the [b]Community Promotion Screen[/b], you can unsubscribe from the [b]New Promotion Screen By Default[/b]. Alternative Mod Launcher will warn you about missing dependencies, but it can be safely ignored in this case.

[h1]New Features[/h1]
[list]
[*] Added [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=667104300]Mod Config Menu[/url][/b] support.
[*] Added and documented multiple events for other mods to interact with.
[*] [b]Ability tagging[/b] - while on the promotion screen, you can click locked abilities to tag them. This is mostly useful for planning out soldiers' ability trees or marking important abilities so you don't forget to unlock them later. [b]This feature is disabled by default[/b], and needs to be enabled in Mod Config Menu. "Show perks from unreached ranks" setting must be enabled as well. Basic tagging mode simply marks abilities with an icon. Advanced mode will also display order numbers to indicate the sequence or priority in which you should unlock the abilities.

[/list]

[h1]Improvements[/h1]
[list]
[*] Vastly improved controller support.
[*] `ClassCustomAbilityCost` entries can now use an empty `ClassName` to make the `AbilityCost` apply to all soldier classes. Class-specific cost still takes priority.
[*] Added localization for SPARK ability row titles in all languages, and in a way that will not interfere with mods adding their own localization for them.
[*] "More info" yellow question mark icon will be shown for all revealed abilities.
[*] Support mutually exclusive abilities setup on ability templates.
[*] Bugfix: scrollbar no longer gets misplaced when in windowed mode.
[*] Bugfix: "promotion available" banner no longer displays if the soldier can't actually unlock any new perks.
[/list]

[h1]Incompatible mods[/h1]
Community Promotion Screen is [b][i]INCOMPATIBLE[/i][/b] with:[list]
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1280477867][b]Musashis RPG Overhaul[/b][/url] - RPGO adds its own promotion screen.
[*] [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1133854368][b][WOTC] Train from Armoury[/b][/url] - redundant with CPS, and prevents CPS from working at all.[/list]

[h1]Compatible mods[/h1]
[list]
[*] Community Promotion Screen can be used together with [b]New Promotion Screen By Default[/b] itself, but then the [b]New Promotion Screen By Default[/b] will be simply quietly disabled and will not do anything. You will also see an in-game warning popup saying that.
[*] [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1130817270]View Locked Skills - Wotc[/url][/b] - Community Promotion Screen already has a "show perks from unreached ranks" MCM setting, but we took some measures so that these mods can coexist without stepping on each other's toes.
[*] [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1716973380][WOTC] Stats on New Promotion Screen[/url][/b] - compatible.
[/list]

[h1]Contributing to the project[/h1]

Everyone is welcome to contribute to the project via [b][url=https://github.com/X2CommunityCore/X2CommunityPromotionScreen]GitHub[/url][/b]

If you encounter a bug or have a suggestion, feel free to open an Issue, or file a Pull Request for one of the open Issues.

[h1]Credits[/h1]

Thanks to [b]RustyDios[/b] for providing the mod preview image.

[h1]"[b]This is 10E, Commander...[/b]

She's a very unique and special model for YoRHa. Unlike the rest of the androids, she's the only model made -- no other copy or previous version exists. She's meant to be a combat model but she was made to be more of a... musician.

Said it helps with morale, according to 10E herself. And honestly, it helps. With the way this war is going Commander, I think we all need it..."[/h1]

[i]- 9S, YoRHa Android, Soldier of XCOM [/i]
[/quote]



[h1]DESCRIPTION [/h1]
---------------------------------
Commanders of XCOM, I give you another new mod from the Nier series: 10Es Armor!

[b]This outfit was fan-made and created by Leo Varas, a big fan of the NieR series. I just happen to be a big fan and enjoy his work. Check out his work if you have not done so already![/b]

[url=https://www.artstation.com/artwork/rAeJR5]Here's Leo Varas's work on 10E![/url]
[url=https://www.artstation.com/leosaurusrex]Here's Leo Varas's Artstation check it out![/url]


[b]This mod adds in only the female variation of the armor. (Pffft as if guys can wear this)[/b]

[quote]
In detail:
[list]
[*] 10E's armor (colorable) for FEMALES ONLY!
[*] 3 versions of hair with physics!
[*] 10E's visor for Helmet, Upper and Lower Face props (Colorable and has physics)!
[*] 10E's skirt for Torso Gear and Thigh deco (Colorable and has physics)!
[*] Individual Arms included!
[*] 10E's Violin included as Torso Gear!
[/list]
[/quote]
[h1] Thanks! Enjoy! Feedback is welcome (good and/or bad)! And don't forget to give it a thumbs-up! [/h1]


[h1] FAQ TIME: [/h1]

[i] Q1 PART I) [OBLIGATORY] Can you port (insert something from NieR: Automata)?! [/i]
I actually *did* have a couple things that I am planning on releasing that are from NieR:Automata. Stay tuned.

[i] Q1 PART II) [OBLIGATORY]Can you port to Vanilla XCOM 2? [/i]

Nope. I am NOT going to port anymore mods to Vanilla. It's a pain to convert it to Vanilla (even switching it back to it when I have mods for WotC is troubling enough for me). [b]If you want to do it then by all means go for it. Don't forget to give credit for the original mod.[/b]

[i] Q2) WOW! You can do armor now?! Can you do -- [/i]

Nope. I don't do requests. Suggestions are noted however. Doesn't mean I'll get to it though.

[i] Q3 ) Donations? Aeronautic senpai please? [/i]

Bringing glory to mankind doesn't require donations.

[i] Q4 ) Why do girls stuff? C'mon man what about guys? [/i]

[img]https://steamuserimages-a.akamaihd.net/ugc/1870678407031771286/0A20F3008779250CA2E580607A649AECA67B4EE4/?imw=5000&imh=5000&ima=fit&impolicy=Letterbox&imcolor=%23000000&letterbox=false[/img]


Got anymore questions? Put in the comments below if you wish. Anyways, ENJOY THE MOD GUYS!


[h1] RELEASE NOTES [/h1]
----------------------
V1.00
Initial Release

V1.01
* Minor armor fixes
** Adjusted normals
** Fixed 10E's butt to be more rounder and have more creases (Thank you Space_Lettuce_OG!)

V1.01a
* Hotfix on 10E's "asset"


[h1] CREDITS [/h1]
----------------

+ [b] Firaxis and 2K [/b] for this wonderful game as well as giving the community this SDK to further expand XCOM's capabilities

+ [b]Platinum Games & Yoko Taro senpai[/b] for the NieR series.

+ [b]Leo Varas[/b] for 10E herself. She is a wonderfully made YoRHa model. Wish she was canon! [spoiler]Wish she was 10"V" not 10E though because of, well, story reasons.[/spoiler]

Thanks for your permission to port her into the XCOM 2 universe!

[url=https://www.artstation.com/artwork/rAeJR5]Here's Leo Varas's work on 10E![/url]
[url=https://www.artstation.com/leosaurusrex]Here's Leo Varas's Artstation check it out![/url]

+ [b] My fellow peeps (you know who you are) for dealing with my simping for the YoRHa androids. Thanks fellas. :)  [/b]

+ [b] You, Commander. For your feedback and taking the opportunity to get one of the deadliest android violinists into XCOM. Your efforts will continue to bolster the Resistance across the globe. Keep up the great work, and good luck Commander. o7 [/b]

[h3]-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.[/h3]
[h3][b]DESCRIPTION[/b][/h3]
[h3]-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.-.[/h3]

This mod adds the Spindrift Knight, an outfit inspired by the character, Eula Lawrence from Genshin Impact, into XCom 2. This model is part of a [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/53728]Skyrim: Special Edition mod by Caenarvon[/url]. Thanks goes out to Aeronautic for getting permission to port this mod to XCom 2! As an extra bonus, this mod include a YoRHa version (Nier: Automata) color scheme. If you're tired of spending countless hours/cash trying to 'pull' Eula, why not pull her in XCom -- FOR [b]FREE!!![/b]

This also marks one of the first mods ever mod to have its assets cooked, meaning for players that the asset no longer locks up the game when selecting the item for the first time, generally better load times, and overall is smaller.

This mod requires the Highlander for the armor part names and to get the material working. 

[quote]If anyone wants to help port other uniforms, or accelerate the rate of more content, feel free to get in touch with me. I really just need more people that are able to rig uniforms to XCOM 2.[/quote]

If you have issues with this mod or spotted a bug, please report it in the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2681081622/3194738434900417633/]Bug Report Thread[/url]. If you want to provide feedback, whether its good or bad, then post in the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/discussion/2681081622/3194738434900424504/]General Feedback Thread[/url].

If you are thinking of downvoting this mod, please provide feedback first, so I know what I should improve on/did wrong.

[h1] (USELESS) LORE QUOTES [/h1]
---------------------------------

[h1] This is a story of a young girl, a foul-mouthed warrior with a deathly curse. Known only as â€œZeroâ€, she was hellbent on one goal: [b]to kill all of her sisters.[/b] 

Her sisters were praised and loved by many all over the world, taking rank as high governmental officials for ADVENT. The world viewed Zero, however, with malice, calling her a â€œcriminalâ€ and a â€œtraitorâ€. For many years she had attempted countless times tracking down her sisters, all of which failed immensely.

She needed help. But who was willing to help her when the whole world was against her?

Luckily, there was. The only ones that did belong to a group of outsiders who bow to no one and hate ADVENT with all their guts.

â€¦ that group, was XCOM. And that was where her story begins.[/h1]
[/quote]

I only hope you didn't do the same. We are a military resistance group, not a place for... y'know, [b]that[/b]...

I swear if she does one more person I am going to personally kick her off the damn ship."[/h1]

[h1] (USELESS) LORE QUOTES [/h1]

[quote]
[h1]As the years passed after XCOMâ€™s fall, ADVENT was formed and took control over the whole world. But with it, came private military corporations as well to aide ADVENT. 

Only one PMC rebelled against them for 20 long years: [b]the Griffin & Kryuger Military Contractor and Security Consultancy Services[/b] -- [b]G&K for short[/b].

Their secret weapon was the heavily modified design of the ADVENT MECS: [b]Tactical Dolls -- or T-Dolls, for short[/b]. Unlike the MECS, these T-Dolls are more agile in their design and fierce in their combat abilities. They also have the same sentience and personalities as humans, thus giving them a human-like design. Ultimately, these androids serve one purpose: [b]to fight on the frontlines and save humanity.[/b] In support of this, their long-standing list of T-Dolls was named after the weapons of the Old World. This organization helped the Resistance around the globe for many years fighting despite ADVENT scrutiny...

...up until XCOM was back from the ashes.

With the revival of XCOM, G&Kâ€™s finest and newest Commander (known only as the â€œShikikanâ€) personally donated one of G&K's finest T-Dolls to XCOM (with the approval of General Kryuger), in hopes of aiding the fight.

[b]That T-Doll is â€œAN-94â€, a cold and quiet soldier of Team DEFY. She is the first, of possibly many, T-Dolls to join XCOM...[/b]
 [/h1]
 [/quote]


[quote]
[i][h1]"Hello, Commander.

I, AN-94, will be under your command from now onâ€¦

Umâ€¦ I want to askâ€¦ No, nevermindâ€¦"[/h1][/i]

- T-DOLL No. 205, â€œAN-94â€, Soldier of Team DEFY (G & K) and XCOM 
 [/quote]



[h1]DESCRIPTION[/h1]
---------------------------------

Commanders of XCOM, I give you another new mod from the Girls Frontline series: AN-94's Gear! 

Unlike other anime-styled mods in the Workshop, the model is nicely fitting into the realism style of XCOM. This model is from the Chinese version of Call of Duty Mobile. This will probably hold us over until GFL 2: Exilium comes out lol.

[b]This mod adds in detail:

[quote]
[list] 
[*] AN-94â€™s Outfit (colorable) for FEMALES ONLY!
[*] AN-94â€™s Hairstyle (Colorable and has physics)!
[*] AN-94â€™s Mask for Upper, Lower, and Helmet props!
[*] Individual arms included!
[*] 3 Torso and Leg options available!
[*] 1 Torso Gear option available!
[*] 1 Thigh Gear option available!
[/list]
[/quote]



[h1] Thanks! Enjoy! Feedback is welcome (good and/or bad)! And don't forget to give it a thumbs-up! [/h1]

[h1] FAQ TIME: [/h1]

 [i] Q1 PART I) [OBLIGATORY] OMG CAN YOU DO --- [/i]

[b]Hold on, UMP-45 is coming. I apologize for the very long convenience. I hope this can hold you guys over for a bitâ€¦ [b]

[i] Q1 PART II) [OBLIGATORY] Can you port to Vanilla XCOM 2? [/i]

Nope. I am NOT going to port anymore mods to Vanilla. It's a pain to convert it to Vanilla (even switching it back to it when I have mods for WotC is troubling enough for me).
[b]If you want to do it then by all means go for it. Don't forget to give credit for the original mod.[/b]

[i]Q2) Why the heck would you do stuff from a Chinese gatcha game? [/i]
[b]Weaponized raifus.[/b]

[i]Q3) Who's best raifu? [/i]
[spoiler] Maschinenpistole 40. Has been and always will be. Fite me. I do love and respect the other weaps, preferably the M1 Garand, Thompson, and M4A1. [/spoiler]

[i]Q4) Tell me Commander, [b]what am I fighting for?[/b] [/i]
[spoiler] Cores. And an end to this PTSD hell. The Commander and SKK have suffered long enough. "What Am I Fighting For" is a banger btw.[/spoiler]



Got anymore questions? Put in the comments below if you wish. Anyways, ENJOY THE MOD GUYS!




[h1] CREDITS [/h1]
----------------
+ [b] Firaxis and 2K [/b] for this wonderful game as well as giving the community this SDK to further expand XCOM's capabilities

+ [b] MicaTeam and Sunborn Games[/b] for the Girlsâ€™ Frontline series (and AN-94 herself). Thanks for making our guns into a waifu worth fighting for. And thanks for the PTSD.

+ [b] Activision, TiMi Studio Group and Tencent Games[/b] for the Call of Duty Mobile game (CN). You guys made AN-94 look GOOD.

+ [b] goldkyo-ko & box[/b] for assistance in helping me get the model and textures of AN-94 from the game COD Mobile (CN). Ð¡Ð¿Ð°ÑÐ¸Ð±Ð¾ guys!

+ [b] My peeps â€“ you know who you are â€“ for dealing with my simping for the raifus of Girlsâ€™ Frontline. [/b]

+ [b] You, Commander. For your feedback and taking the opportunity to get one of the cutest T-Dolls into XCOM. Your efforts will continue to bolster the Resistance across the globe. Keep up the great work, and good luck Commander. o7 [/b]

Entries.Name: X2WOTCCommunityHighlander v1.23.2
Entries.Author: x2communitycore
Entries.Description:
[h1]What is Highlander?[/h1]

Highlander replaces a big portion of the game's code in order to make it more moddable and mod-compatible, as well as fix a lot of bugs.

As implied by the name, only one Highlander mod can be used at a time. Hence, the Highlander tries to address as many use cases as possible. Not counting fixing bugs, the Highlander does not change the behavior of the game, it merely provides ways for other mods to do so.

Everything that goes into Highlander undergoes rigorous testing and peer review. 

[h1]How do I use the Highlander?[/h1]

Subscribe to the mod and enable it in your mod launcher like you would any other. You should see the Highlander's name and current version appear in the lower right corner of the game's main menu screen.

[h1] Alien Hunters DLC Plugin[/h1]

If you have [b]Alien Hunters DLC[/b] installed and enabled, and you are using this version of the Highlander, then you also should install the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2534737016][b][WOTC] Alien Hunters Community Highlander[/b][/url] plugin as well.

Do [b][i]NOT[/i][/b] install that plugin if you do [b][i]NOT[/i][/b] have the Alien Hunters DLC.

[h1]Useful Links[/h1]
[list]
[*] [b][url=https://github.com/X2CommunityCore/X2WOTCCommunityHighlander/wiki/Troubleshooting]Highlander Troubleshooting[/url][/b] - if you have issues running the game with Highlander active.
[*] [b][url=https://www.reddit.com/r/xcom2mods/wiki/mod_troubleshooting]Mod Troubleshooting[/url][/b] - for issues with other mods.
[*] [b][url=https://x2communitycore.github.io/X2WOTCCommunityHighlander]Highlander Documentation[/url][/b] - for modmakers.
[*] [b][url=https://github.com/X2CommunityCore/X2WOTCCommunityHighlander]Highlander GitHub Page[/url][/b] - for issue reports and contributions.[/list]

Thank you for using the Highlander. Our objective is to support all modders to be all they can be, so if you have suggestions please let us know.

Entries.Description:
This mod is a plugin for [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1134256495][b]X2 WOTC Community Highlander[/b][/url].

This plugin is [b][i]REQUIRED[/i][/b] if you have the [b]Alien Hunters DLC[/b]. 

If you do [b][i]NOT[/i][/b] have the Alien Hunters DLC, then you should [b][i]NOT[/i][/b] use this plugin, as it may cause gamebreaking issues.

Similar to the Highlander itself, this plugin replaces script packages of the Alien Hunters DLC in order to make the it more moddable and mod-compatible, as well as fixing some bugs.

[h1]How do I use this plugin?[/h1]

Install and enable this mod as usual. You do not have to do anything else. Make sure to use it [b][i]ONLY[/i][/b] if you have Alien Hunters DLC installed and enabled.

If you require help or wish to contribute to this project, please follow the links in the [b][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1134256495]main Highlander description[/url][/b].

Contributions to this plugin are accepted through the main Highlander repository, which now contains both the Highlander itself and this Alien Hunters plugin.

Entries.Name: [WotC] Mod Config Menu
Entries.Author: guby
Entries.Description:
This mod (MCM) is a shared settings menu. Some mods require this mod in order for you to use the in-game configuration menus. 

For full details on using this mod, troubleshooting, or even building your own mods to use this menu, visit: https://github.com/andrewgu/ModConfigMenu 

=================================================

Nexus Link: http://www.nexusmods.com/xcom2/mods/573/

This version has been updated for War of the Chosen. For a version compatible with the base game, look for "Mod Config Menu Legacy" here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1122831824

Latest Update:

- Bug fix for an issue from the previous update that caused some mods to fail to save settings.

Previous Update:

- Performance improvements to make the options menu load faster and close faster, especially if you have a lot of mods.

=================================================

Compatiblity:

- Works with the Tactical Legacy Pack update.
- Compatible with WotC.

Go here for the legacy version, which supports the original base game: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1122831824

If you are experiencing compatibility issues, as always, feel free to notify me in the comments.

=================================================

NOTICE FOR PEOPLE REPORTING THAT THIS MOD IS CAUSING IN-GAME PROBLEMS:

Thanks to everyone who has taken the time to report issues with MCM. It obviously sucks if the options menu, of all things, is what's breaking your game, and I'd like to get these issues addressed ASAP. However, it's next to impossible for me to test every version of every mod that also uses MCM, so I need your help as well to troubleshoot issues.

If you are seeing graphical glitches or problems transitioning between Avenger/Missions, please check two very specific details for me and let me know the result in your comment: 

1. If you turn off all mods except MCM, does the problem still happen?
2. Does the problem happen only after you've visited the Options screen, only after you've visited the Mod Options screen, or regardless of whether you've visited either screen?

Because of how extensively MCM interacts with other mods and how certain UI components interact, these two details will help me a lot with pinpointing the problem.

Entries.Name: [WOTC] Capnbubs Accessories 2022

Entries.Description:

Entries.Name: (T:R) TERMINATOR: RESISTANCE - The Stranger's Gear [WOTC]
Entries.Author: ($S360)Aeronautic
Entries.Description:
[h1] (T:R) TERMINATOR: RESISTANCE - THE STRANGER'S GEAR [WOTC] [/h1]

-------
[b] Please Read Desc for more info! [/b]



[b] NOT COMPATIBLE WITH VANILLA XCOM 2 [/b]
--------

[h1] (USELESS) LORE QUOTES [/h1]

[quote]
[h1]"No idea who he is, Commander.

Not even Rivers or Jennifer know who he is.  He does seem to know an awful lot about what's happening. As if he knows what's bound to happen in the future...

For sure, it ain't Rivers...

Although he does sound like him."[/h1]

- Central Officer Bradford
[/quote]

[quote]
[h1]"Wait. He came from the future?! How the heck?!

And I thought I was the only one that was destined to change the future...

Guess I don't feel special anymore."[/h1]

- Lt. [strike]Lucina[/strike] "Marth", Soldier of XCOM
[/quote]



[h1]DESCRIPTION[/h1]
---------------------------------

Commanders of XCOM, I give you a new mod from the game Terminator Resistance: the Mysterious Stranger's Gear!

[b]This mod adds in detail:[/b]

[quote]
[list] 
[*] The Stranger's Gear (colorable) for MALES ONLY!
[*] 3 Torso Options
[*] 1 Shin Option
[*] 1 Thigh Option
[*] The Stranger's Hoodie (Upper, Lower, and Helmet Capabilities) with 3 Options!
[/list]
[/quote]


[h1] Thanks! Enjoy! Feedback is welcome (good and/or bad)! And don't forget to give it a thumbs-up! [/h1]

[h1] FAQ TIME: [/h1]
[i] Q1) [OBLIGATORY] Can you port to Vanilla XCOM 2? [/i]

[b]Nope. I am NOT going to port anymore mods to Vanilla. It's a pain to convert it to Vanilla (even switching it back to it when I have mods for WotC is troubling enough for me).

If you want to do it then by all means go for it. Don't forget to give credit for the original mod.[/b]

[i] Q2) What's with the slow uploads, man? You okay? [/i]
Been busy -- that's why I don't upload a lot. Sorry guys. I really mean it when I kinda do things at my own pace.

Also, thanks to the lovely recent events, things have been really tight on the modding schedule. Anyways stay safe out there fellas.

[spoiler]See you in a few months for another mod release /s [/spoiler]

Got anymore questions? Put in the comments below if you wish. Anyways, ENJOY THE MOD GUYS!



[h1] KNOWN ISSUES [/h1]
----------------------
* When removing the Hoodie, there is this huge gap around the neck. Cover it up with another hood, this mod's Hood option, or another cosmetic option.



[h1] RELEASE NOTES [/h1]

----------------------
V1.00
Initial Release






[h1] CREDITS [/h1]
----------------
+ [b] Firaxis and 2K [/b] for this wonderful game as well as giving the community this SDK to further expand XCOM's capabilities

+ [b] Teyon and REEF Entertainment [/b] for Terminator: Resistance -- and the Stranger himself.
(Yes those are the same guys that made Rambo The Video Game.)

+ [b] Gildor for UModel -- extraction tool was possible by him. Thank you![/b]

+ [b] You, Commander. For your feedback and taking the opportunity to get one of the most strange looking Resistance Heroes into XCOM. Your heroic efforts will continue to bolster the Resistance across the globe. Keep up the great work, and good luck Commander. o7 [/b]


[h1] DISCLAIMER [/h1]
-------------------
THIS PRODUCT IS NOT ENDORSED BY NOR AFFILIATED WITH FIRAXIS GAMES, TEYON, REEF ENTERTAINMENT, ETC. THIS PRODUCT CONTAINS CONTENT COPYRIGHTED BY FIRAXIS GAMES (XCOM 2) / TEYON AND REEF ENTERTAINMENT (CHARACTER STRANGER, GAME TERMINATOR RESISTANCE, AND VARIOUS MEDIA) THAT MAY NOT BE REUSED WITHOUT OWNER'S EXPRESSED PERMISSION. THIS MOD WILL NOT BE USED FOR MONETARY PURPOSES/GAIN. PLEASE DO NOT REUPLOAD ANYWHERE ELSE.

Brilliant man. Also had the finest damn troopsâ€¦

â€¦ Speaking of that, Commander, the General himself has offered us one of his finest squads to help in the fight. They are [b]Aurora Squad[/b]. A young bunch of gals, but with the same loyalty and fighting spirit as XCOM. Not to mention that they are well-trained too.â€ [/h1]

[i] â€“ Central Officer Bradford [/i]
 [/quote]

[i] â€“ Sq. Ruby Rose, probably [/i]
 [/quote]


[h1]DESCRIPTION[/h1]
---------------------------------

Commanders of XCOM, I give you another new mod from the Warface series: Aurora Squad! 

[b]This mod adds in detail:

[quote]
[list] 
[*] AURORA SQUAD (MODERN â€“ the Current Version used in Warface) for FEMALES ONLY!
[*] AURORA SQUAD (BETA â€“ the Beta Version before transitioning to Current) for FEMALE ONLY!

[*] Compatible with kexxâ€™s Female Cosmetics Pack as well as others that uses XCOMâ€™s base body!
[*] Multiple Torso/Thigh Gear options available!
[*] Backpacks and other gear as Torso & Thigh Gear options available!
[/list]
[/quote]



[h1] Thanks! Enjoy! Feedback is welcome (good and/or bad)! And don't forget to give it a thumbs-up! [/h1]

[h1] FAQ TIME: [/h1]

 [i] Q1 PART I) [OBLIGATORY] OMG CAN YOU DO --- [/i]

Nope. I am NOT going to port anymore mods to Vanilla. It's a pain to convert it to Vanilla (even switching it back to it when I have mods for WotC is troubling enough for me).

---------------------------------

[quote]
[h1] "Sorry Honoka, but none of our armors seem to fit you. 

No, it's not because you're fat. It's because of your... uh...

... well your [b]'honkers'[/b], to put it bluntly. None of the Kevlar vests are big enough to fit them in easily and make them too squished. I'm sure we can ask Shen something to help fix it.

In the meantime, I guess you can use your school outfit to fight for the time being.

... and no you cannot wear the Newcomer outfit either -- Central hates it. Last thing we want is all of XCOM troops not hitting their shots because they got distracted staring at you and your big chest."[/h1]

[i]- "Menace", Soldier of XCOM[/i]
[/quote]

[quote]
[h1] "Honoka's big chest is filled with hopes and dreams..."[/h1]

[i]- The Commander, probably[/i]
[/quote]


[h1]DESCRIPTION [/h1]
---------------------------------

Commanders of XCOM, I give you another new mod from the Dead or Alive series: Honoka's Outfits!

Anyways they are as follows:

[/list]
[/quote]


[h1] Thanks! Enjoy! Feedback is welcome (good and/or bad)! And don't forget to give it a thumbs-up! [/h1]

[i] Q1 PARI I) [OBLIGATORY] What happened to the Newcomer outfit? I thought that was included in it too? [/i]

[b]Dunno what you're talking about. I will say this though: I recommend you check the XComContent.ini and the XComGame.int in their respective folders to enable/disable certain options for cosmetics. I may or may not have included extra goodies in there too. Duuno what you may find though.

The mod is located here:
C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\workshop\content\268500\2700371757[/b]


[i] Q1 PART II) [OBLIGATORY] Can you port to Vanilla XCOM 2? [/i]

Ninjas don't need donations.


[i] Q4 ) Disgusting weeb. Keep that filth in Japan. [/i]

Too late. The world is filled with ADVENT filth. Time to purge the xeno scum by usin' skimpy girl fighters.

Too many bones make Aero a dull boy. I could, but it takes forever to do. Do you see how flowy their hair is!? Yeah, thats a LOT of bones to deal with. We'll see, but don't hold your breath. Until then, wait, bother kexx, or try it yourself and prove me wrong.

[h1]INCLUDES:[/h1]

- Default and Colorable options.
Applies to all 3 armor tiers and faction units.

Thumbs up if you like this mod :D

Special thanks to .vhs and nekoworkshop :)

[h1]INSTRUCTIONS[/h1]
This mod includes cosmetic items that are assigned to parts that may be hidden (eg. forearms, shoulder, torso gear, thighs and shins) to selection. If this is the case for you, the simplest way to freely equip/ remove these parts from your soldiers is to subscribe to the following mods: 

Mr. Kablamm0Fish's Empty WOTC Deco Slot (unlock these parts and add invisible option for standard XCOM soldiers)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1127014384

and Nekoworkshop's Invisible Parts for Hero (Faction) Units (for the Hero classes).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125697296

[h1]FAQ:[/h1]

[h1]Q: I cannot remove cosmetics parts on my soldiers because I can't select those parts to unequip![/h1]
A: This mod includes cosmetic items that are assigned to parts that may be locked out for selection in the base game. Simply put, this is how the game works. If this is the case for you, the simplest way to fix it is to subscribe to the following mods: 

Mr. Kablamm0Fish's Empty WOTC Deco Slot (unlock these parts for standard XCOM soldiers)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1127014384

and Nekoworkshop's Invisible Parts for Hero (Faction) Units (for the Hero classes).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125697296

Q: Tattoos are appearing stretched/ clipped on the torso, can you fix it?
A: Unlike the bodies from the main game that do not accpet tattoos applying on the body, this torso body does.There is no perfect solution to "fix" this problem aside from either entirely disable tatoos to be accepted on the torso (where tattoos can create jarring cut off lines where the arm and the torso meets anyway), or create entire new sets of Tatoos with fixed UVs. As such I have decided to leave it as is.

Q: Vanilla Version?
A: There are no plans for vanilla version for any of my mods since I started modding way after WOTC was released. And because it's way too much of a PITA. If you so want to port it over yourself and have proven skills to do so, contact me. :)

Q: Add face please?
A: When I know how and have the time to do so.

Q: I have a nifty screenshot featuring the mod, can it be featured on the preview screens?
A: Yes! I'm running out of ideas for cool screenshots, in fact I would encourage you to post a steam screenshot link down below, and I'll choose some nifty ones to be up there, with credits for your image :)

[h1]KNOWN ISSUES:[/h1]
Scarf wing prop visual may not refresh within customization screen upon unequipping. It is only a temporary visual error, you can still customize your soldier as usual. Back out the customization screen will fix it. Will fix when I find a solution.

Entries.Name: Clean Full Body Armours
Entries.Author: MrCloista
Entries.Description:
This mod seeks to fix the problem that certain DLC and Modded armours have when their default Torso is 'full body' (Torso, Arms, Legs in one piece), where other parts are generated, causing horrible clipfest monstrosities.

To make this work, this mod Forces non-Torso parts for supported armours to be completely blank. This now occurs each time you equip supported armours.

[h3]Supported Armours[/h3]
The armours supported are added in the XcomGame.ini file in this mod and are fully configurable incase there are other armours you want to add support for.

[b]By Default, Supported Armours are:[/b]
[list]
[*]Alien Ruler Armours
[*]TLE 'Class' Armours
[*]Infiltrator Disguises - Civilan and ADVENT
[*]Prototype Armoury's - Prototype TLE Armours
[*]The Hive - Hive Queen Armour
[*]Resistance Warrior Armour
[/list]

[h3]Known Issue[/h3]
If you change the Torso cosmetic for these armours you will roll random cosmetics in some or all of the other cosmetic parts categories. To fix this, UNEQUIP, THEN RE-EQUIP the armour with the full body torso.  [b]If using [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2664422411]APPEARANCE MANAGER[/url] please ensure you delete the [b]Stored Appearance[/b] for the relevant armour before you do this.[/b]

Incompatible with Unrestricted Customisation if using a standard (not full body) torso as your main torso in customisation.

[h3] Credits and Thanks[/h3]
Credit to [b]RustyDios[/b] for taking several hours to work on the code with me (and yet another awesome modpreview),  and [i]Kexx, Mitzruti[/i] for their input.
Major Credit and Thanks goes to TeslaRage and Xymanek (Astral Descend), for providing new code which fixed the original issue this mod faced.

Enjoy!! If you like what I do, please  [url=https://www.buymeacoffee.com/mrcloista]Buy my Cats a Bag of Treats[/url]

Entries.Name: One Million Colours
Entries.Author: -bg-
Entries.Description:
ALSO ENABLE THIS IF YOU ARE USING WOTC: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/1133948141

ENABLE THIS IF YOU USE IT WITH SPARKS: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/1134598754

Adds one million colours to props customization (configurable through XComGame.ini).

Config START_INDEX indicates the number of visible colour panel by default, which is the preset colours you can choose in the colour picker without using the sliders, it is clamped down to number of existing colours in your game so you can increase it if you have other colour mods and you want them to be part of the presets.
NUM_COLOR_PER_BASE is the number of levels for the each of the 3 base colours, so you will get NUM_COLOR_PER_BASE^3 additional colours in total.

Known issue: There will be a slight lag when opening the colour picker from unsupported screens and photobooth or unpatched soldier classes.

Note: Changing configs of this mod will break all the custom colours saved (change into random colours), this is due to how xcom 2 save the appearance of the soldiers, instead of saving the actual colours it store an index which is referenced in a pool of available colours, which this mod expands.

Note 2: Adding 1 million colours to all palettes takes 4 seconds of additional loading time, so don't get too crazy on adding NUM_COLOR_PER_BASE

Compability:
Overrides UIColorSelector and CustomizationManagerClass of character templates.
Does not work with mods that overrides XComCharacterCustomization, overriding XComCharacterCustomization through XComEngine.ini is asking for weird behaviours in UICustomize anyways.
WORKS WITH WOTC

Entries.Name: Empty WOTC Deco Slots for XCOM Soldiers (+ Some other empty things)
Entries.Author: Mr Kablamm0fish
Entries.Description:
13/Sept/2017: Fixed Alien Hunter's empty WOTC slot implementaion x2

12/Sept/2017: I've made [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1133849751] this [/url] to fix some issues with alien hunters armour and added the empty legs shoulders and arms to this mod, replacing the need for alien hunter ini edits, resistance armour ini edits are still required.

6/Sept/2017: Feature creep time:
Added optional empty arms and legs for Resistance dlc and Alien Hunter dlc armour, copy everything from readme (YourSteamFolder\steamapps\workshop\content\268500\1127014384) into this mods XComContent.ini, at the end of the file.
Added empty shoulder slots for Resistance dlc and Alien Hunter dlc armour.

4/Sept/2017: Added Empty shoulder slots for Tier 3 as they do not have any set up by default.

Currently adds empty slots for:
Empty WOTC slots on XCOM soldiers, all armours
Empty Anarchy's Children Shoulder slots for T3, Resistance and Alien Hunters
Optional (i.e. copy from everthing readme into ini) empty left and right arms for Resistance and Alien Hunters
Optional (i.e. copy from everthing readme into ini) empty legs for Resistance and Alien Hunters

This mod itself doesn't really do anything apart from add invisible decos to the new slots added in WOTC to conventional XCOM soldiers in a similar way to nekoworkshop's [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1125697296] [WOTC] Invisible Parts For Hero Units [/url] (Which [b]is[/b] for faction heroes).

This is a mod required by my mods (and apperantly other mods now) that adds the new deco options introduced in WOTC to conventional XCOM Soldiers (i.e. not the faction heroes) +T3 Empty Anarchy's Children Shoulders

The menus probably won't even show up unless you have another mod which adds deco items to the listed slots as slot menus don't show up in the chargen unless there is more than 1 option in that menu. Don't ask me why, it's a coding thing.

Entries.Name: [WotC] Part Names for Vanilla Armors
Entries.Author: Lago
Entries.Description:
[h1]Features[/h1]
This mod adds descriptive names to all the vanilla parts in the game, following the style introduced in the DLC packs and War of the Chosen.

[h1]Compatibility[/h1]
This is just localisation text for an existing Community Highlander feature. If another mod renames the same parts, one will override the other, but apart from that this is compatible with everything.
